newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Australia's Cossack oil output down, ships delayed.
newsitem.headline: Australia's Cossack oil output down, ships delayed.

text.p: Cossack offshore crude oil production in Australia slumped to around 50,000 barrels per day (bpd) on Friday as operators continued to wrestle with problems in a gas export system, company sources said.
The operators have also delayed by three weeks six shipments of Cossack crude with lifting dates from September to the middle of October, the sources said.
The next scheduled uncommitted cargo of Cossack was for the second half of October, they said.
On Wednesday, Woodside Petroleum Ltd said repair work at Cossack would cut production to 50,000 bpd for the last three weeks of September.
Equal partners in the field are Woodside, Japan Australia LNG (MiMi) Pty Ltd and units of The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd, British Petroleum Co Plc, Chevron Corp and Royal/Dutch Shell Group.
However, the sources said production was already suffering as the operators try to manage technical problems exporting assocated gas into a regional gas grid.
The Cossack problems are helping to firm the light sweet crude market, which is already finding strong support as refiners look to maximize middle distillate production.
The rise in dated Brent crude oil prices has also diverted attention onto light regional grades because dated-related West African crudes are relatively expensive.
